input.title: Effects of caffeine on cognitive performance
input.abstract: Background: Caffeine is widely consumed. Methods: 120 participants randomized to caffeine (200mg) or placebo. Primary outcome: reaction time. Results: Caffeine group showed 15% faster reaction time (p<0.001). Conclusion: Caffeine improves cognitive performance.

input.title: Metformin and cardiovascular outcomes
input.abstract: Objective: Assess metformin's effect on CV events. Design: Retrospective cohort of 5000 T2D patients over 10 years. Main outcome: Major adverse cardiac events (MACE). Findings: Metformin associated with 22% reduced MACE risk (HR 0.78, 95% CI 0.65-0.93). Limitations: Observational design.

input.title: Mindfulness meditation for anxiety
input.abstract: Background: Anxiety disorders are prevalent. Methods: Meta-analysis of 25 RCTs (n=2500) comparing mindfulness-based interventions to waitlist controls. Outcome: Anxiety severity (GAD-7). Results: SMD=-0.56 (95% CI -0.72 to -0.40), p<0.0001. Heterogeneity: I²=64%. Conclusion: Moderate effect of mindfulness on anxiety.

input.title: Vitamin D supplementation in elderly
input.abstract: Aim: Determine if vitamin D reduces falls in elderly. Setting: Nursing homes, 800 residents aged 65+. Intervention: Vitamin D3 2000 IU daily vs placebo for 12 months. Primary endpoint: Fall incidence. Results: No significant difference (RR 0.95, 95% CI 0.80-1.13, p=0.56). Adverse events similar between groups.

input.title: Deep brain stimulation for Parkinson's disease
input.abstract: Introduction: DBS is established for advanced PD. Methods: Systematic review of 18 studies (N=1200). Outcome: UPDRS motor score improvement. Findings: Mean improvement 52% (range 39-68%). Quality of life: significant gains in PDQ-39 scores. Safety: 8% perioperative complication rate.

input.title: SGLT2 inhibitors and heart failure
input.abstract: Background: SGLT2i show promise in HF. Trial: EMPEROR-Preserved, 5988 patients with HFpEF randomized to empagliflozin 10mg daily or placebo. Primary: CV death or HF hospitalization. Median follow-up 26 months. Results: Hazard ratio 0.79 (95% CI 0.69-0.90), p<0.001. NNT: 31. Conclusion: Empagliflozin reduces events in HFpEF.

expected_output.outcome_primary: cardiovascular death or heart failure hospitalization

input.title: Exercise for depression in adolescents
input.abstract: Objective: Evaluate exercise interventions for adolescent depression. Design: Network meta-analysis of 35 RCTs (n=3500). Interventions: Aerobic, resistance, mixed, yoga vs usual care. Outcome: Depression scores (BDI/CESD). Results: All exercise types superior to control. Aerobic: SMD=-0.62, Resistance: SMD=-0.48, Yoga: SMD=-0.53. SUCRA rankings favor aerobic. No serious adverse events.

input.title: Aspirin for primary prevention
input.abstract: Context: Aspirin's role in primary prevention debated. Study: Pooled individual participant data from 13 trials (164,000 participants). Outcome: Major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) and major bleeding. Duration: Mean 6.5 years. Results: Aspirin reduced MACE by 11% (RR 0.89, 95% CI 0.84-0.95) but increased major bleeding by 43% (RR 1.43, 95% CI 1.30-1.56). Net benefit unclear.

input.title: Bariatric surgery for type 2 diabetes
input.abstract: Aim: Compare bariatric surgery to intensive medical therapy for T2D. Trial: STAMPEDE, 150 obese patients with uncontrolled T2D randomized 1:1:1 to Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, sleeve gastrectomy, or intensive medical therapy. Primary: HbA1c <6% at 5 years. Results: Surgical arms achieved target in 29% (RYGB) and 23% (sleeve) vs 5% (medical), p<0.001. Mean weight loss: 23%, 19%, 5% respectively.

input.title: Telemedicine for hypertension management
input.abstract: Background: Telemedicine may improve BP control. Methods: Pragmatic cluster-RCT, 40 primary care clinics (8000 hypertensive patients). Intervention: Remote BP monitoring + pharmacist teleconsultations. Control: Usual care. Outcome: Proportion achieving BP <140/90 at 12 months. Results: Intervention 72% vs control 58%, absolute difference 14% (95% CI 10-18%), p<0.0001. Cost: $50/patient incremental.

expected_output.intervention: remote blood pressure monitoring + pharmacist teleconsultations
